page.title: 03Ynysangharad Park,Pontypridd
page.content: This park is situated at the side of the River Taff.Miners contributed 1d of their wages and door-to-door collections were made to help build it.It was opened in 1925.The owner was called Mr Lenox.In the park there is a statue in memory of Evan James and James James, the composers of the Welsh National Anthem,and a memorial to the men who died in the Falklands War.The bandstand is a cheerful place, bands play there every Saturday afternoon. There is a cricket pitch, tennis courts,bowling green, swimming pool, rugby ground and a golf area. In the play area there is a big paddling pool, swings and two slides. The senior citizens day-centre was opened nine years ago. From Coed-y-Lan school:Claire Roberts, T.Griffiths,T.Emmanuel,C.Gummery,Seren Morgans,Natasha Yusuf,Sharon Jenkins.
